name: Overview
data:
[{"id":"c421fb78-93ff-495a-8016-79ee8c72c56c","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Function: dfs","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2229d974-4ddb-4a57-944c-806180c42a01","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Description
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"The ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dfs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" function (which implements a Breadth-First Search logic) is the core reference-unwinding engine used during data resolution. Its purpose is to traverse the "points-to" graph of a variable, starting from a specific namespace and following every possible link until it reaches terminal values. It systematically replaces variable names with the actual objects or types they represent, such as classes, functions, or literal type tags like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<int>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" and ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<str>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"8de87eca-d280-4910-a91a-1ea4cb54c0db","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Why this matters
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"In Python, a single variable name is often just a temporary alias. If you have code like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"a = 10; b = a; c = b","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", the analyzer needs a way to realize that ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"c","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is ultimately an integer. ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"dfs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" provides this capability by "walking" the chain of assignments. It is designed to be exhaustive, meaning if a variable could point to multiple different types due to conditional logic (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"x","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" is either a string or a list), this function will find and return ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"all","styles":{"italic":true}},{"type":"text","text":" of those possibilities, ensuring the analysis remains sound and comprehensive.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"6b5162b0-e851-4d0f-8d0c-0afaa0cb540f","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"How it works","styles":{"bold":true}}],"children":[]},{"id":"1a6ae685-3140-4e9a-8cac-212a7977498b","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Queue Initialization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It starts with a queue containing the initial namespace string and an empty ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"visited","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" set to track its progress and prevent infinite loops.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"2cab1b08-7b57-4bf0-9ce2-1ba07a47c934","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Breadth-First Traversal:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" It enters a loop, pulling the next namespace from the queue and processing it:","styles":{}}],"children":[{"id":"ace99e5d-3e4a-4113-8a04-98c93d55ef8f","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Pointer Following:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the namespace refers to a pointer-like definition (a variable, parameter, or return value), the function retrieves all its recorded values and adds them to the queue for further exploration.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"9cbe39be-372f-4ad8-b1d9-38cc2c7a79b9","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Terminal Normalization:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" If the namespace refers to a terminal type (like an integer, string, list, or dictionary), it converts the definition into a standardized tag (e.g., ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<int>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") and adds it to the result set.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f7b588b1-e971-41ba-9e48-12b5299e1828","type":"bulletListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"String Matching Fallback:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" As a safety measure, it checks the namespace string itself for internal type markers (like ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<dict>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" or ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<list>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":") to ensure internal data representations are captured even if a formal definition object is missing.","styles":{}}],"children":[]}]},{"id":"8bedf8c4-a73f-4df2-a606-487c20d18eb6","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Deduplication:","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":" Once the queue is empty, it returns a set containing all unique terminal values and definitions discovered.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"82c49600-14e9-454e-99d3-ec91144741d2","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"Example Scenario
","styles":{"bold":true}},{"type":"text","text":"Tracing a function argument ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" that was passed ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"config['path']","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":":","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"4dd38ff5-ada8-462a-b994-9f442dc71f20","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"dfs","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" starts at ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.func.data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"0d4051d5-8310-4c3f-babf-a6227480811d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It follows the link to ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"module.config.<map_1>.path","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":".","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"3f543d8f-1d19-4dab-8e1f-fb16f0610d17","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It explores that definition and finds it was assigned a literal string.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"31bafa75-d8b4-4e17-ae8d-962077a384df","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It identifies the ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"STR_DEF","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" type.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"f553bd2e-f829-4acb-84b3-568bff89d96d","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"It adds ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"<str>","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" to the result set.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"c17f5502-f8cf-406e-b219-28b9a29b5283","type":"numberedListItem","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[{"type":"text","text":"The function returns ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"{"<str>"}","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":", allowing the analyzer to treat ","styles":{}},{"type":"text","text":"data","styles":{"code":true}},{"type":"text","text":" as a string within the function body.","styles":{}}],"children":[]},{"id":"bc1af3b6-1f4a-46af-b17b-a4b272243b27","type":"paragraph","props":{"backgroundColor":"default","textColor":"default","textAlignment":"left"},"content":[],"children":[]}]
